description:
Abbreviated script for priests administering the sacrament of confession
 to Indigenous people. It includes the priest's initial admonition, then
 questions they should ask before the confession, on the Ten 
Commandments, to each gender, to married persons, to local officials, 
and on the seven mortal sins, concluding with an admonition.| Collation 
formula: a²⁰. Format: 4o. Dimensions: 21 x 16 cm. Binding: Parchment 
with straps. Marginalia: None. Illustrations: Woodcut of Christ in a 
press shedding blood from his wounds supported by two angels on the 
title page, vignettes, and initials. Type: Gothic.
owning_repository: Biblioteca General Histórica, Universidad de Salamanca

description:
Unabridged Spanish-Nahuatl guide with scripts for priests administering 
the sacraments to Indigenous people. It includes guidelines and 
questions the priests should ask Indigenous congregants to assess their 
understanding of confession, baptism, marriage, and doctrine (i.e. Ten 
Commandments and seven mortal sins). There is also a section for scribes
 writing last wills and testaments with an example based on an 
Indigenous couple from Texcoco.| Errors in foliation: Alternate pages 
unnumbered. After page 84, page numbers may or may not be followed by 
periods. The "7" on page 78 is upside down. Format: 4o. Dimensions: 20.5
 x 15 cm. Binding: Vellum. Marginalia: Some. Illustrations: Woodcut of 
Calvary on the title page, vignettes and capitulars. Type: Gothic. Type:
 Gothic.

libros,junto a la ygleſia de ſeñor Sant Augu=ſtin: a quinze de Mayo. 
Año.de.1565. Laus deo."| Colophon: "¶ Acaboſe de impri=mir eſte

description:
This is
 the Spanish-Nahuatl part of a two-volume dictionary. It begins with 
twelve notices then lists Spanish terms followed by Nahuatl translations
 in alphabetical order. The second volume is the Nahuatl-Spanish 
dictionary.| Errors in foliation: Pages 37 and 98 are repeated. Page 45 
for 44 and page 47 for 55. Lacks a page 51. Format: fo. Dimensions: 17 x
 27 cm. Binding: Marbled hardcover. Marginalia: None. Illustrations: 
Woodcut of the coat-of-arms of Viceroy Martin Enríquez on the title 
page, a penitent and a printer's device on the last folio, and 
capitulars. Type: Roman.
general_note:
Encuadernado con "Vocabulario en lengua mexicana y castellana". La 
primera edición conocida de este diccionario es de 1555. Texto principal
 en columnas dobles. Colofón (vol. 2, folio 162r): "AQVI HAZEN FIN LOS 
DOS VOCABVLARIOS, EN LENGVA CASTEllana y nahual oMexicana que hizo y 
recopilo el muy Reuerendo padre, fray Alonſo de Mo-lina: dela orden de 
ſeñor ſan Franciſco. Imprimieronſe enla muy inſigne y gran ciudad de 
Mexico: en caſa de Antonio de Spinoſa.enel Año de nueſtra 
redēpcion.de.1571. NICAN TZONQVICA YN ONTETL VOCABVLARIOS Y-pan 
Caſtillan tlatolli yuan nauatlatolli, yn oquimotlalili cenca 
mauiztililoni,totatzin fray Alonſo de Molina, teupixqui Sant Franciſco. 
Omicuilo nican ypan vey altepetl ciudad Mexico:ychā Antonio de Spinoſa. 
Ypan xiuitl. 1571.Años."| Bound with "Vocabulario en lengua mexicana y 
castellana". The earliest known edition of this dictionary is from 1555.
 Main text in double columns. Colophon (vol. 2, folio 162r): "AQVI HAZEN
 FIN LOS DOS VOCABVLARIOS, EN LENGVA CASTEllana y nahual oMexicana que 
hizo y recopilo el muy Reuerendo padre, fray Alonſo de Mo-lina: dela

ciudad de Mexico: en caſa de Antonio de Spinoſa.enel Año de nueſtra

creator_contributor: Domingo de la Anunciación, Father, 1510 or 1511-1591 (author)
description:
Abridged doctrine in dialogue form that contains explanations and 
philosophical arguments related to the moral and theological principles 
necessary for a Christian life. It discusses the articles of Faith, 
sacraments, the commandments, the mortal sins, the works of mercy, the 
five senses, and the parts of the soul.| Format: 4o. Dimensions: 14 x 
20.5 cm. Binding: Linen. Marginalia: None. Illustrations: Woodcut of the
 Virgin Mary and Christ child on a pedestal with a bishop, penitent, and
 king below looking on between folios 83 and 84 and Charles V's 
coat-of-arms on the last page. Type: Gothic.
general_note:
Español y náhuatl en columnas paralelas. Hojas alternas sin numerar. 
Colofón: "¶ A gloria y alabāça de nȓo redēptor jeſu xþo y de ſu ben=dita
 madre y Քa vtilidad y prouecho de las aias, aʠ ſe acaba la declaracion 
breue y cōpēdioſa de la doctrina xþiana ē lēgua eſpañola y mexicana, 
ſentencia por ſentēcia, Fue ympreſſa en eſta muy leal ciudad đ mexico en
 caſa đ pedro ocharte por mādado đl ylluſtriſsimo y reuerēdiſsimo ſe=ñor
 dō fray alōſo đ mōtufar, Arçobiſpo đ la dicha ciudad meritiſsimo 
acaboſe a 15. dias đl mes đ março. 1565 años."| Spanish and Nahuatl in 
parallel columns. Alternate leaves unnumbered. Colophon: "¶ A gloria y 
alabāça de nȓo redēptor jeſu xþo y de ſu ben=dita madre y Քa vtilidad y 
prouecho de las aias, aʠ ſe acaba la declaracion breue y cōpēdioſa de la
 doctrina xþiana ē lēgua eſpañola y mexicana, ſentencia por ſentēcia, 
Fue ympreſſa en eſta muy leal ciudad đ mexico en caſa đ pedro ocharte 
por mādado đl ylluſtriſsimo y reuerēdiſsimo ſe=ñor dō fray alōſo đ 
mōtufar, Arçobiſpo đ la dicha ciudad meritiſsimo acaboſe a 15. dias đl

description:
Quechua
 and Aymara-language catechism. It contains a brief and abbreviated 
doctrine, a short discussion on the principles of the Christian faith, 
notes on the translation of the doctrine into the Indigenous languages, 
and sermons.| Collation formula: AA⁸, A-I⁸, K¹². Format: 4o. Dimensions:
 21.5 x 15.5 cm. Binding: Parchment with gilt irons. Provenance marks: 
Bookplate of the Royal College of the Society of Jesus of Salamanca. 
Illustrations: Woodcuts of the coat of arms of the Society of Jesus on 
the title page and colophon, ornaments and initials. Type: Roman.
general_note:

 encuadernado con Confessionario para los curas (1585) y Tercero 
cathecismo (1585).| Spanish text spans entire page and the Quechua and

description:
Quechua
 and Aymara-language confessional script for priests tending to 
Indigenous communities. It contains questions for Indigenous nobles, 
exhortations for after the confession, a treatise on Indigenous rituals 
and ceremonies ("idolatries"), a listing of ecclesiastical privileges 
granted by various popes, and impediments to the sacrament of 
matrimony.| Collation formula: AA⁸, *A-*C⁸, A-B⁸, Aa-Cc⁸. Format: 4o. 
Dimensions: 21.5 x 15.5 cm. Binding: Parchment with gilt irons. 
Provenance marks: Bookplate of the Royal College of the Society of Jesus
 of Salamanca. Illustrations: Woodcuts of the coat of arms of the 
Society of Jesus on the cover, ornaments, and initials. Type: Roman.
general_note:
Texto a
 plana en castellano y paralelo a dos columnas en quechua y aymara. Esta
 encuadernado con Doctrina christiana (1584) y Tercero cathecismo 
(1585). Colofón: "Impreſſo en la ciudad de los Reyes, por Antonio 
Ricardo, primero Impreſſor en eſtos Reynos del Piru. Año de M.D.LXXXV."|
 Spanish text spans entire page and the Quechua and Aymara versions are 
in two parallel columns beneath it. It is bound with Doctrina christiana
 (1584) and Tercero catechismo (1585). Colophon: "Impreſſo en la ciudad 
de los Reyes, por Antonio Ricardo, primero Impreſſor en eſtos Reynos del
 Piru. Año de M.D.LXXXV."

creator_contributor:
Balaguer de Salcedo, Pedro, active 1582 (author)| Hawkins, Richard, 
Sir, 1562?-1622 (author)| Castro y de la Cueva, Beltrán de, 1550-1618 
(contributor)
description:
Chronicle of the preparations and expedition led by Beltrán de Castro, 
the brother-in-law of the viceroy of Peru, to fight the English pirate 
Richard Hawkins. The work recounts the composition of the fleet, the 
details of the battle, and how the victory was achieved by the Spanish 
vessels.| Collation formula: A-B⁸, A⁸. Format: 8o. Dimensions: 15.5 x 
10.5 cm. Binding: Parchment with tape remnants. Marginalia: None. 
Provenance marks: Manuscript note indicating Gaspar Antonio (S.I.) as 
previous owner and the Royal College of the Society of Jesus 
(Salamanca). Illustrations: Large woodcut coat of arms on the title page
 and initials. Type: Roman.
general_note:
Contiene: "Treslado de una carta de Ricardo Hauquines, escrita en el 
puerto de Perico, en seys de agosto, de 1594 años para embiar a su 
padre Iuan Hauquines a Londres". Sin colofón.| Contains: "Treslado de 
una carta de Ricardo Hauquines, escrita en el puerto de Perico, en seys 
de agosto, de 1594 años para embiar a su padre Iuan Hauquines a 
Londres". No colophon.
